definitions.definition: for which there is a fair and acceptable reason

examples.text: Politicians are legitimate targets for satire.
Parents' concerns about the disease are quite legitimate.
People have a legitimate expectation that their politicians should be honest.
The court ruled that celebrities' children were not a legitimate target for press intrusion.

definitions.definition: allowed and acceptable according to the law

examples.text: the legitimate government of the country
The legitimate government was reinstated after the uprising.

definitions.definition: born when its parents are legally married to each other

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘born of parents lawfully married to each other’): from medieval Latin legitimatus ‘made legal’, from the verb legitimare, from Latin legitimus ‘lawful’, from lex, leg- ‘law’.
